com.ojcoleman.ahni.nn

Class BainNN

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.ahni.nn.NNAdaptor
      • com.ojcoleman.ahni.nn.BainNN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Activator, XmlPersistable

    public class BainNN
extends NNAdaptor

    Provides an interface to Bain neural networks to allow integration with the ANJI/AHNI framework.

    Bain neural networks are not well suited to feed-forward networks as every neuron and synapse must be activated every simulation step. Bain is intended for recurrent networks, however the implementations of Activator.nextSequence(double[][]) and Activator.nextSequence(double[][]) are optimised to provide amortised performance over the number of input sequences for layered feed-forward networks.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BainNN

        public BainNN(com.ojcoleman.bain.NeuralNetwork nn,
      int[] inputDimensions,
      int[] outputDimensions,
      int stepsPerStep,
      BainNN.Topology topology)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new BainNN with the given Bain neural network.
        Parameters:
        nn - The Bain neural network to use.
        inputDimensions - The size of each dimension in the input, see Activator.getInputDimension(). At the moment only one or two dimensional input vectors are supported, so this array should only be of length one or two accordingly. Dimensions should be in the order x, y.
        outputDimensions - The size of each dimension in the output, see Activator.getOutputDimension(). At the moment only one or two dimensional output vectors are supported, so this array should only be of length one or two accordingly. Dimensions should be in the order x, y.
        stepsPerStep - The number of simulation steps to perform in the Bain neural network for each call to next(..) or nextSequence(..) methods. For feed-forward networks this should be equal to the number of layers. For non-layered feed forward networks this value will be calculated automatically, the supplied value will be ignored.
        topology - Specifies the network topology, see topology.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • BainNN

        public BainNN(com.ojcoleman.bain.NeuralNetwork nn,
      int[] inputDimensions,
      int[] outputDimensions,
      int stepsPerStep,
      BainNN.Topology topology,
      java.lang.String name,
      int maxCycleLength)
       throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new BainNN with the given Bain neural network.
        Parameters:
        nn - The Bain neural network to use.
        inputDimensions - The size of each dimension in the input, see Activator.getInputDimension(). At the moment only one or two dimensional input vectors are supported, so this array should only be of length one or two accordingly. Dimensions should be in the order x, y.
        outputDimensions - The size of each dimension in the output, see Activator.getOutputDimension(). At the moment only one or two dimensional output vectors are supported, so this array should only be of length one or two accordingly. Dimensions should be in the order x, y.
        stepsPerStep - The number of simulation steps to perform in the Bain neural network for each call to next(..) or nextSequence(..) methods. For feed-forward networks this should be equal to the number of layers. For non-layered feed forward networks this value will be calculated automatically, the supplied value will be ignored.
        topology - Specifies the network topology, see topology.
        name - A name for this BainNN.
        maxCycleLength - When determining if this network is recurrent, the maximum cycle length to search for before the network is considered recurrent. Note that this is set to the smaller of the given value and number of neurons in the network.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • next

        public java.lang.Object next()
        Returns:
        Object output array of type double with dimensions dependent on implementation, given last provided input activation via nextSequence(double[]) or nextSequence(double[][]).
        See Also:
        Activator.nextSequence(double[][]), Activator.nextSequence(double[][][])

      • next

        public double[] next(double[] stimuli)
        Returns:
        double[] output array given input stimuli.

      • next

        public void next(double[] stimuli,
        double[] output)
        Description copied from class: NNAdaptor
        Retrieve the output from network for the given input. This method accepts an array to store the output of the network in, rather than possibly creating a new output array for every call. This default implementation simply copies the output of Activator.next(double[]) to the given output array, but sub-classes may override this method more efficiently.
        Overrides:
        next in class NNAdaptor
        Parameters:
        stimuli - The input to the network.
        output - An array to put the output from the network in.

      • nextSequence

        public double[][] nextSequence(double[][] stimuli)
        Returns:
        double[][] sequence of output arrays given input sequence stimult.

      • nextSequence

        public void nextSequence(double[][] stimuli,
                double[][] result)
        Description copied from class: NNAdaptor
        Retrieve a set of output vectors from network for the given sequence of input vectors. This method accepts an array to store the output of the network in, rather than possibly creating a new output array for every call. This default implementation simply copies the output of Activator.next(double[][]) to the given output array, but sub-classes may override this method more efficiently.
        Overrides:
        nextSequence in class NNAdaptor
        Parameters:
        stimuli - An array of input vector arrays.
        result - An array of output vector arrays to put the sequence of output vector values in.

      • nextSequence

        public void nextSequence(double[][][] stimuli,
                double[][][] result)
        Description copied from class: NNAdaptor
        Retrieve a set of output matrices from network for the given sequence of input matrices. This method accepts an array to store the output of the network in, rather than possibly creating a new output array for every call. This default implementation simply copies the output of Activator.nextSequence(double[][][]) to the given output array, but sub-classes may override this method more efficiently.
        Overrides:
        nextSequence in class NNAdaptor
        Parameters:
        stimuli - An array of input matrix arrays.
        result - An array of output matrix arrays to put the sequence of output matrix values in.

      • getInputDimension

        public int[] getInputDimension()
        Returns:
        dimension(s) of input array. If the input array is a single dimension vector then the returned array will have length 1; in general the returned array will have as many elements as there are dimensions in the input vector.

      • getOutputDimension

        public int[] getOutputDimension()
        Returns:
        dimension(s) of output array. If the output array is a single dimension vector then the returned array will have length 1; in general the returned array will have as many elements as there are dimensions in the output vector.

      • setStepsPerStepForNonLayeredFF

        public void setStepsPerStepForNonLayeredFF()
        (Re)calculates the number of steps required to fully activate a non-layered feed-forward network. If this network is not of type BainNN.Topology.FEED_FORWARD_NONLAYERED then this method does nothing and returns immediately.
